title: Client-stats stops validator from functioning (and doesn't work itself)
body:
# üêû Bug Report ### Client-stats prevents validator from functioning (and doesn't work itself) When I run client-stats and connect to the beacon and validator, two things happen: 1) I get JSON that has no useful stats 2) the validator process stops processing validatiions ### Has this worked before in a previous version? Actually the client-stats binary used to crash prysm completely, so this is a step up. D: ## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction Start beacon and use --monitor-indices to monitor your validator(s). Start Validator. Then go to your client-stats binary and connect to both validator and beacon (on 127.0.0.1 in my case), see error-2.png ## üî• Error See error.png 

[2022-09-21 17:09:30] WARN validator: block stream interrupted error=rpc error: code = Unavailable desc = connection error: desc = "transport: Error while dialing dial tcp 127.0.0.1:4000: connect: connection refused": could not connect efused"
[2022-09-21 17:09:30] WARN validator: block stream interrupted error=rpc error: code = Unavailable desc = connection error: desc = "transport: Error while dialing dial tcp 127.0.0.1:4000: connect: connection refused": could not connect
[2022-09-21 17:09:31] ERROR validator: Could not request attestation to sign at slot error=rpc error: code = Unavailable desc = connection error: desc = "transport: Error while dialing dial tcp 127.0.0.1:4000: connect: connection refused" pubKey=0x91d66da9828c slot=4745745
[2022-09-21 17:09:34]
Also, the JSON vacant of any useful data on client-stats: ./client-stats-v3.1.1-linux-amd64 --beacon-node-metrics-url=http://127.0.0.1:8080/metrics --validator-metrics-url=http:/127.0.0.1:8081/metrics [2022-09-21 17:08:25] WARN main: No --clientstats-api-url flag set, writing to stdout as default metrics sink.
